image.altText: She stands in the main street and wears a jumper with a bird on it

props.synopsis: Rural residents in Tasmania's north hope a recent council decision will spell the end for a developer wanting to build almost 300 homes.

title.children: Pushback against developer's plan to build about 300 homes near village

image.altText: A digital rendering the entrance to a stdium.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's parliamentarians have received a draft version of the order they'll vote on to determine the fate of the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

title.children: A draft order to approve Hobart's stadium has been released. What's in it?

image.altText: Bell Bay Aluminium aerial shot.

props.synopsis: Bell Bay Aluminium has told staff the company faces a "significant risk" after negotiations for a new power deal stalled, jeopardising its future.

title.children: Major Tasmania aluminium smelter delivers 'unsettling news' to staff

image.altText: A large white and yellow ship with cranes and lifeboats on the side.

props.synopsis: Two years after the RSV Nuyina was banned from going under Hobart's Tasman Bridge to refuel, the Australian Antarctic Division has formally ditched the possibility of trying to overturn the decision.

title.children: Icebreaker's costly bridge ban won't be reassessed

image.altText: Kerry Forrest standing on the street.

props.synopsis: In the three years that 65-year-old Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

title.children: 'I'm 65. That's what's different': Kerry has never had trouble finding work — until now

image.altText: Waves smashing against the shore in Penguin.

props.synopsis: Residents on the north and west coast of Tasmania are being warned to secure loose items around their homes ahead of wind gusts of up to 125 kilometres per hour.

title.children: Tasmanians urged to make preparations for damaging wind gusts

image.altText: Nina Korbe wears a red velvet formal gown with a black silk cape and sings into a microphone on stage with a broad smile.

props.synopsis: The Australian Women in Music Awards recognised contributions across the music sector, from artists, to photographers, journalists, filmmakers, and leaders.

title.children: Ruby Hunter, Shellie Morris and Missy Higgins among winners at Australian Women in Music Awards

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen smiling in front of a European flag.

props.synopsis: The European Commission president has faced criticism from the left and right after striking a tariff deal with the United States.

title.children: Ursula von der Leyen survives no-confidence votes in EU parliament

image.altText: A short woman with auburn hair is surrounded by men walking and looking serene

props.synopsis: Husamettin Dogan, 44, was the only one to have maintained his appeal after the first trial last year of 51 men, including Gisele Pelicot's husband, in the case of mass sexual abuse that shocked France and the world.

title.children: Jail term increased for man who appealed Gisele Pelicot rape conviction

image.altText: A baby in a white top with cartoon animals on it lies on a rug on the floor with her fist against her mouth.

props.synopsis: The death of a 15-week-old baby in an unlicensed home day care in Victoria’s north-west is among more than two dozen disturbing childcare incidents recorded in government documents unearthed by the ABC.

title.children: Infant's death in illegal child care kept hidden from public

image.altText: A man with grey hair poses for a portrait near a leafy brick wall

props.synopsis: László Krasznahorkai has been awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, one of the world's most prestigious writing awards.

title.children: Hungarian writer receives Nobel Prize in Literature for 'visionary oeuvre'

image.altText: Nour looks lovingly at Mo while smiling.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Mustafa and Nour Dalloul got married while bombs exploded around them. Now their war-torn love, forged in the emergency rooms of a Gazan hospital, has found a home in Australia.

title.children: Gaza doctor who told the world of horrors finds romance and a new start

image.altText: Tony Burke sits alongside Anthony Albanese in question time

props.synopsis: This week in Canberra, Tony Burke finally answered questions about the return of Islamic State relatives, Senate estimates turned into an episode of Utopia, and Andrew Hastie quit the frontbench.

title.children: Tony Burke steps in for PM over return of Islamic State relatives

image.altText: A close up head-on shot of an Aboriginal woman in yellow and blue striped guernsey, serious expression, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: A fatal hit-and-run case in Darwin has exposed deep disparities in the NT’s justice system, say Aboriginal leaders, as the victim’s family speaks out.

title.children: 'There's no justice': Outrage as Jake Danby walks after fatal hit-and-run

image.altText: A man giving a speech at a lecturn. He wears a row of service medals on his jacket.

props.synopsis: The president of RSL NSW Mick Bainbridge has resigned from the board along with three other directors in a shock move just minutes before a scheduled vote on his removal.

title.children: RSL NSW bosses resign following ABC investigation

image.altText: Dark military aircrafts viewed head-on on a runway

props.synopsis: Department of Defence officials distance themselves from F-35 fighter jet parts allegedly shipped from Australia to Israel, saying the material is the property of Lockheed Martin.

title.children: Defence officials grilled over report F-35 fighter jet parts sent from NSW to Israel

image.altText: Mitch Brown speaking to the Daily Aus.

props.synopsis: After coming out, Mitch Brown became an unofficial spokesperson for queer issues in the AFL. While that experience has been overwhelmingly positive, it's also come with an onslaught of hate.

title.children: 'Not shying away': Mitch Brown on the hate that's come with coming out

image.altText: A woman in a pink blazer stares into the middle distance

props.synopsis: The NT chief minister is ignoring requests for information about rules for a taxpayer-funded VIP chauffeur service after claiming trips to a pizzeria and golf club were above board.

title.children: NT chief ignores requests for private driver rules after pizzeria trip

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and cap looks into camera

props.synopsis: Two of Narrabri's three water supplies have been switched off amid claims the state government is "taking too long" to find a solution to a chemical contamination issue.

title.children: Narrabri rations water amid PFAS contamination 'crisis'

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A teenager who allegedly posted terrorism propaganda online and made threats to kill has been denied bail.

title.children: Teenager who allegedly pledged allegiance to Islamic State denied bail

image.altText: Shirtless man in sporting ring with hands out

props.synopsis: In the footage obtained by the ABC, several shots could be heard ringing out as a toddler was seen standing in a driveway metres from where Suman Mokhtarian was killed.

title.children: Footage shows moments after gunman opened fire at Sydney MMA fighter

image.altText: Woman with grey curly hair looking to the left

props.synopsis: The original group was formed in October 1947 at a time when the US government worried that there were communists in Hollywood who were putting left-wing propaganda into the movies.

title.children: Jane Fonda helps revive Hollywood's McCarthy-era free speech group

image.altText: Man lying face down on the road, handcuffed behind his back next to a car with the door open. He's surrounded by police and cars

props.synopsis: It is a tried and true tactic in the underworld when trying to get away with murder, but police have sought out "kill cars" and they are reaping the rewards from it.

title.children: Police turn attention to use of 'kill cars' in attempted underworld hits

image.altText: harald neumann

props.synopsis: An Australian pokie machine giant says it is reviewing its chief executive's future after a US gaming regulator spurned his licence application.  It comes months after the ABC revealed he was the subject of a corruption investigation in Austria.

title.children: Future of pokies boss 'under review' after US licence troubles

image.altText: Leek Aleer with his palms facing the sky

props.synopsis: St Kilda officially adds Liam Ryan in a trade with West Coast as the AFL world continues to react to the Saints' stunning decision to pull out of a move for Leek Aleer. Here's how day four of the AFL trade period panned out.

title.children: Saints under fire as brutal trade backflip leaves young defender 'shattered'

image.altText: Albanese looks straight ahead at the podium of a press conference with an Australian flag behind him

props.synopsis: A Queensland man accused of threatening to kill the prime minister has been refused bail, with a magistrate describing his alleged threats as "deeply disturbing."

title.children: Man accused of threatening to kill PM allegedly wrote he was ready to 'sacrifice' himself

image.altText: Laura Heath and Joseph Heath on their bed with books in the background

props.synopsis: After 10 years of marriage and two kids, Joseph Heath and wife Laura are still in the "honeymoon phase". He says romance novels are a large part of why.

title.children: Joseph says romance novels have kept the spark alive in his marriage

image.altText: A close up of a surfboard showing clear bite marks.

props.synopsis: A man who witnessed the "extraordinary" moment a surfer was bitten by a shark chasing a seal offshore Kangaroo Island has spoken to the ABC after his footage circulated online.

title.children: 'Always go surfing with a doctor': Shark attack witness shares 'extraordinary' moment

image.altText: Australian agribusiness Elders

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog has given the go-ahead for Elders to acquire its competitor, Delta, but it must sell six Delta stores in WA to improve competition.

title.children: ACCC approves Elders' $475m acquisition of agribusiness rival Delta

image.altText: Screenshot of game A man in a leather jacket with a hat looks over his shoulder towards camera

props.synopsis: The sound world of Indiana Jones is iconic. While in Australia, the video game's audio director shares how he leveraged this to bring the game world to life.

title.children: Whips to grunts, how game creators use music to evoke the world of Indiana Jones

image.altText: A steel tree sculpture silhouetted against an orange and purple sunset sky on the Goondiwindi plains.

props.synopsis: Goondiwindi's Lanescape art collective transforms the Queensland border town into an open-air gallery featuring large steel sculptures.

title.children: Farm scraps turned sculptures put Goondiwindi on the map

image.altText: A shot from behind shows a man sitting at a desk looking at a computer screen.

props.synopsis: An Australian university has accused thousands of its students of cheating with artificial intelligence. The problem? Many have done nothing wrong.

title.children: University caught out using AI to wrongly accuse students of cheating with AI

image.altText: A medium shot of a woman standing next to a box of tiny art pieces

props.synopsis: A new tiny art gallery on WA's south coast adds to a growing global movement of community verge-side offerings that range from puzzles to seed exchange.

title.children: Gallery of tiny treasures joins global community
